fr.playsoft.android.tools.operation

Class OperationQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.playsoft.android.tools.operation.OperationQueue

  • public class OperationQueue
extends Object
    Class that manages a queue of Operations. Operations are launched simultaneously using a pool of Threads.
    Author:
    Olgierd Uzieblo

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MAX_THREADS_NUM
      Number of operation performing threads

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OperationQueue(Context pContext)
      Creates this OperationQueue.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addOperation(Operation pOperation)
      Adds new Operation to the queue.
      void finish()
      Finishes - stops all threads.
      int getCurrentMaxPriority()
      Gets priority that is currently the highest used.
      Operation getNextOperation()
      Gets next Operation with the highest priority.
      boolean isBusy()
      Checks if there are any operations left to start.

    • Method Detail

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Finishes - stops all threads.

      • isBusy

        public boolean isBusy()
        Checks if there are any operations left to start.
        Returns:
        True if something is still left in Operations queue.

      • addOperation

        public void addOperation(Operation pOperation)
        Adds new Operation to the queue.
        Parameters:
        pOperation - Operation to add.

      • getCurrentMaxPriority

        public int getCurrentMaxPriority()
        Gets priority that is currently the highest used.
        Returns:
        Current max priority.

      • getNextOperation

        public Operation getNextOperation()
        Gets next Operation with the highest priority.
        Returns:
        Next Operation that is not running yet. Return null if there are no operations left.
